entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 4:19PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...GUSTY WINDS AND HIGH WAVES EXPECTED TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY... A strong low will bring impactful weather to Southwest Alaska, primarily for the Greater Bristol Bay region, tonight through Friday. Gusts of 35-45 mph are likely, with gusts as high as 60 mph possible from Kamishak Bay into interior Bristol Bay. Waves up to 10-15 ft are also possible over Bristol Bay Thursday night

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 4:19PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG WINDS, HIGH WAVES, AND MODERATE TO HEAVY RAIN EXPECTED TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY... A strong low immediately south of the Central Aleutians will move into the southern Bering through Thursday with impactful weather forecasted for the Aleutian Islands and Alaska Peninsula tonight through Thursday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Alaska Peninsula; Central Aleutians; Eastern Aleutians

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 1:51PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Friday and Friday Night... Elevated surf is expected to develop along the West Coast Friday and Friday night with values of 1 to 3 feet above MHHW (the normal high tide). Westerly winds of 20 to 30 mph with gusts to 40 mph will push large waves up the beach. The wave action may cause minor erosion. Residents with items on the beach should move them
